messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Virus Accidently Sent in "Homeschooler Needs Our Help" Message
messages.msgSnippet: Amy you have the virus too.  Like someone else said you can use McAfee s website.  You may have an anti-virus on your computer now that you can use. Gayle ...
messages.messageBody:
Amy you have the virus too.  Like someone else said you can use McAfee's website.  You may have an anti-virus on your computer now that you can use.
Gayle
  
----- Original Message -----
From: K WORTHEN
To: Unschooling-dotcom@...
Sent: Thursday, April 27, 2000 9:18 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Virus Accidently Sent in "Homeschooler Needs Our Help" Message

do you know how to do this?
still very computer illiterate,
Amy
----- Original Message -----
From: Linda Sternhill Davis
To: VenturaCountyHomeLearnrs@... ; Linda Sternhill Davis
Cc: CaliforniaHS@... ; -SoCalHomeschooling@... ; Team-CHN@... ; Unschooling-dotcom@... ; WORKandHOMESCHOOL@...
Sent: Wednesday, April 26, 2000 11:55 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Virus Accidently Sent in "Homeschooler Needs Our Help" Message

With all my good intentions of disseminating information about Debbie and her Uncle, and requesting recipe submissions for Debbie's fundraising cookbook, I wasn't aware that a kak virus was also being sent to everyone.  Thanks to a couple of eGroup members who alerted me to the fact that this virus had been transmitted with my e-mail, I was able to use my Norton AntiVirus program and eventually remove the kak virus from my computer.  It was found lurking in the signature part of my Outlook Express. 
 
I, therefore, apologize for any problems or inconvenience this has caused others.  I do want everyone to know about this problem, so steps can be taken immediately to remove the virus from your systems.
 
'Sorry!
 
Linda
 
 
  
----- Original Message -----
From: Linda Sternhill Davis
To: VenturaCountyHomeLearnrs@...
Cc: WORKandHOMESCHOOL@... ; Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com ; Team-CHN@egroups.com ; -SoCalHomeschooling@egroups.com ; CaliforniaHS@egroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, April 25, 2000 10:02 PM
Subject: Homeschooler Needs Our Help

Hi All!
 
I received the following e-mail from a fellow homeschooling mom who lives in the San Diego area.  The message is self-explanatory, and Debbie has given me permission to reprint it here.  I'd really like to help her and her uncle out, so I'd like to spread the word as much as I can.  Please feel free to let others know, as well.  Please note the May 15th deadline.  Here goes:
 
********************************
 
I'm busy with a project to help my favorite uncle who was recently diagnosed
with cirrhosis of the liver and hepatitis C. He's a world renowned venomous
reptile specialist, and married to my husband's aunt. They're coming out in
June, in fact. I'm organizing some fundraisers for them, since it's
outrageously expensive to even be placed on the organ transplant list - you
need to be on Medicaid (they denied them due to her making too much money -
unreal) or you need to have $250,000.00 in an account. And that cost is just
to get on the list.

Feeling helpless isn't my style, so I'm compiling a cookbook. If you have
any lemon recipes you'd be willing to share, I would appreciate it so much!
Or just post the request for recipes that is on my signature line to your
e-list. Perhaps they would be willing to chip in!

Sincerely,
Debbie Nelson
Share a lemon recipe by 5/15/00 to benefit
my uncle's liver transplant -
Get a free ad in the cookbook and online!
<a href="mailto:When_Life_Gives_You_Lemons@..."> </a>

Message boards, timely articles, a free newsletter and more!
Check it all out at: http://www.unschooling.com

To Unsubscribe: mailto:Unschooling-dotcom-unsubscribe@onelist.com
